Ingredients: Egg wash (1 egg beaten with a splash of milk)
Instructions: Mix pumpkin puree, sugar, and spices in a bowl.
Roll out the pastry dough and cut it into small circles.
Place a spoonful of the pumpkin mixture in the center of each circle.
Fold the dough over to create a half-moon shape and crimp the edges with a fork.
Brush the pasties with egg wash.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown.
Mix pumpkin puree, brown sugar, and spices in a bowl.
Spoon the mixture into mini tart shells.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 15-20 minutes or until set.
Let cool and garnish with whipped cream.
Combine the pumpkin juice, apple juice, and honey in a saucepan.
Add cinnamon sticks and a pinch of ground nutmeg.
Simmer for 15 minutes, then remove the cinnamon sticks.
Serve warm or chilled.
Mix butterscotch syrup and pumpkin puree in a saucepan over low heat.
Stir until well combined, then cool.
Pour the butterscotch and pumpkin mixture into glasses.
Top with cream soda and whipped cream.
Drizzle with caramel sauce for extra flavor.
Sauté the onion and garlic in a pot until soft.
Add the pumpkin puree and vegetable broth, and simmer for 20 minutes.
Blend the soup until smooth, then return it to the pot.
Stir in the heavy cream and season with salt and pepper.
Heat through and serve.

Pumpkin Soups.Recipe Name: Spicy Pumpkin and Black Bean Soup
Ingredients: 1 can of black beans, drained and rinsed
Sour cream and fresh cilantro for garnish
Instructions: Sauté the onion, garlic, and red pepper in a pot until softened.
Add the pumpkin puree, black beans, and spices.
Stir in the vegetable broth and simmer for 20 minutes.
Serve with a dollop of sour cream and a sprinkle of fresh cilantro.
